input: Statement: Thus, an effective performance management system can be a strategic tool for organizations to drive internal change and achieve external results. Choices:  1. Organizations can't use performance management systems to encourage internal change. 2. Organizations tend to be more concerned with external results than internal change. 3. Organizations can use performance management systems to encourage internal change.

Statement: A few people scratched their heads; wondering if this might be a joke. Choices:  1. A few people scratched their heads because the joke was so offensive. 2. People were wondering if it was a joke. 3. Everyone knew that it was a joke.

Statement: you know if everybody's trying to incorporate a little bit of it into into their school and they made sure they pointed it out you know Choices:  1. If all of the people are trying to incorporate a little bit of it into their school. 2. Nobody should incorporate that into their school. 3. If all of the people are trying to incorporate a little bit of it into their school then everything would be better.
